intro: Ixora zeyheri, commonly known as the flame bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of bright orange-red flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its flowers are borne in terminal panicles and bloom from autumn to spring, attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Ixora zeyheri is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its vibrant color and hardy nature.
